mechanoreception.notes: Chitons generally possess mechanoreceptors for sensing touch and pressure. Likely present in Abyssochitonidae.

chemoreception.notes: Chitons typically use chemoreceptors to detect chemical cues in their environment. Likely present in Abyssochitonidae for food detection and other purposes.

vision.notes: The presence or absence of eyespots or other visual structures is unknown for this family. Other chitons have eyespots, but it is unknown if this family does.
